decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing evasive creatures and low-cost spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format. Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow serves as the commander, with a variety of ninjas, rogues, and other small creatures to trigger her ability and deal damage. The deck includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Counterspell to protect the game plan, as well as card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain card advantage. The goal is to apply pressure early with unblockable or flying creatures, while controlling the opponent's board and hand to secure victory through combat damage or other means like card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. By utilizing low-cost, high-impact burn spells and creatures with haste like Kari Zev, Skyship Raider and Goblin Guide, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the very beginning of the game. With a high concentration of direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Fireblast, the deck seeks to finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Searing Blaze also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and buy the deck more time to burn them out.

This deck focuses on utilizing Arahbo's ability to pump up your cat creatures and enhance their combat abilities, allowing you to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes a wide variety of both aggressive creatures and support cards to ensure you can consistently apply pressure and maintain board presence. With a mix of efficient early game creatures, powerful pump spells, and disruptive cards to control the board, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board state and close out the game before your opponent can stabilize. By using Arahbo's abilities effectively and playing aggressively, you can overpower your opponent and secure victory in fast-paced one-on-one matches.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav, the Multifarious as a powerful combo piece, enabling various graveyard interactions and powerful control elements. The deck includes a range of tutors, reanimation spells, and combo pieces like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Griselbrand to quickly assemble game-winning combos. It also includes a suite of disruptive spells like Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to control the game and protect its key combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and spells, then bring them back with reanimation spells for explosive plays that can overwhelm the opponent. The control elements help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the combo can be executed successfully.

This deck revolves around aggressive play and dealing direct damage to the opponent using a variety of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize their board. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Flame Slash, and Lava Spike are used to deal damage directly to the opponent, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Ahn-Crop Crasher provide early pressure on the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Hell's Thunder and Hazoret the Fervent as finishers to close out the game. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent and prevent them from establishing a strong defense while steadily chipping away at their life total.

This deck revolves around using Kess, Dissident Mage as the commander to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and efficient creatures. The main focus is on disruption, removal, and card advantage, with a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck also includes versatile cards like Demonic Tutor and True-Name Nemesis to give it flexibility in different situations. With a diverse land base including dual lands, fetch lands, and utility lands, the deck aims to consistently hit its mana requirements and provide options for different scenarios. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck revolves around utilizing lands and graveyard recursion to generate value and create a powerful engine that can lead to a game-winning combo. By using cards like The Gitrog Monster, Ramunap Excavator, and Crucible of Worlds, the deck can repeatedly play and sacrifice lands to draw cards and ramp up mana. The deck also includes various land search and recursion spells like Scapeshift, Sylvan Scrying, and Life from the Loam to ensure a steady stream of resources. Additionally, the deck includes powerful disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Toxic Deluge to control the game and protect its combo. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to efficiently utilize lands and graveyard recursion to build up resources and eventually win the game through a powerful combo.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with Titania, Protector of Argoth leading the charge. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with mana dorks and land ramp spells to bring out powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. The deck also utilizes land destruction and recursion to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats on the battlefield. With cards like Sylvan Library and Mirri's Guile for card selection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures and efficient mana usage. The strategy revolves around creating a fast, aggressive board presence to pressure the opponent and secure victory.
